parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided data does not contain any CMF number.  This is not conclusive evidence of non-propaganda, but it's a factor to consider.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions "Valeriu Iftime" and asks if Botoșăneni trust his team for the Romanian Parliament. This directly refers to a candidate participating in the parliamentary elections.  This strongly suggests that Article 36 (7) - a applies.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, targeting a wide geographical area (Botoșani County and surrounding areas) and age range (18-65).  The use of hashtags (#voceabotosani #Botosani) further indicates an attempt to reach a broad audience. This fulfills the criteria of Article 36 (7) - c.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The core question posed in the post ("Au încredere botoșănenii în echipa Valeriu Iftime pentru Parlamentul României?") directly aims to gauge public opinion regarding Valeriu Iftime's candidacy. The clear objective is to influence voters' perception of the candidate and potentially increase votes for him. This strongly suggests that Article 36 (7) - c applies.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post lacks the characteristics of journalistic reporting. It doesn't present objective facts, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it focuses on a single candidate and directly solicits an opinion that could influence voting behavior. It does not meet the standards of journalistic reporting.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post is not a personal opinion; it's a targeted campaign message designed to sway public opinion towards a specific candidate. The phrasing is not neutral and aims to elicit a response that benefits the candidate.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>444817985328121</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, given its explicit mention of Valeriu Iftime in the context of the parliamentary elections, its targeted geographical reach within Botoșani County, its clear intention to influence voters' opinions, and its lack of journalistic objectivity, strongly suggests it constitutes electoral propaganda. The paid nature of the post further reinforces this conclusion. While the absence of a CMF number is not definitive, the other factors heavily outweigh this absence.  The post's design and wording are clearly aimed at promoting Valeriu Iftime's candidacy.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Valeriu Iftime</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Vocea Botosani</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Vocea Botoșani, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook (ID: 444817985328121), după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează candidatura lui Valeriu Iftime la alegerile parlamentare. Postarea, cu o cheltuială de 400-499 RON,  adresată publicului larg din județul Botoșani și zonele limitrofe, conține întrebarea directă: „Au încredere botoșănenii în echipa Valeriu Iftime pentru Parlamentul României?”, având ca efect electoral clar influențarea votului în favoarea candidatului menționat.  Lipsa unui număr CMF nu diminuează caracterul de propagandă electorală, având în vedere contextul clar al alegerilor și intenția evidentă de a influența votul.  Postarea, vizualizată de 70.000-80.000 de persoane,  constituie o încălcare a legii, fiind propagandă electorală după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie.  Datele de contact ale advertiserului sunt office@voceabotosani.ro și +40759112233.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
